20110103030431.000|20110103030434.000|TR0|It's been a long time coming for 9/11's 
20110103030434.000|20110103030436.000|TR0|first responders.  They can now though get 
20110103030436.000|20110103030439.000|TR0|federal coverage for health problems that 
20110103030439.000|20110103030441.000|TR0|they trace back to their time working at 
20110103030441.000|20110103030444.000|TR0|ground zero.  President Obama signed the 
20110103030444.000|20110103030447.000|TR0|bill while on vacation in Hawaii.  There 
20110103030447.000|20110103030449.000|TR0|was no official signing ceremony, but the 
20110103030449.000|20110103030452.000|TR0|White House did release this photo here.
20110103030452.000|20110103030454.000|TR0|
20110103030454.000|20110103030457.000|TR0|Congress pushed the bill through last 
20110103030457.000|20110103030500.000|TR0|month in that lame duck session. It 
20110103030500.000|20110103030502.000|TR0|creates a $4 billion program for first 
20110103030502.000|20110103030505.000|TR0|responders who say that they got sick 
20110103030505.000|20110103030507.000|TR0|while working in the rubble at ground 
20110103030507.000|20110103030510.000|TR0|zero.  New York Senator Kirsten Gillibrand 
20110103030510.000|20110103030513.000|TR0|helped bring this bill back from the dead 
20110103030513.000|20110103030515.000|TR0|before Congress went to recess.

20110103030602.000|20110103030604.000|TR0|KEILAR:  The full name of the bill is 
20110103030604.000|20110103030607.000|TR0|actually the James Zadroga 9/11 Health and 
20110103030607.000|20110103030610.000|TR0|Compensation Act.  Zadroga was a New York 
20110103030610.000|20110103030612.000|TR0|City police detective.  He died from a 
20110103030612.000|20110103030615.000|TR0|respiratory illness in 2006 when he was 
20110103030615.000|20110103030617.000|TR0|just 34.  He's often cited as the first 
20110103030617.000|20110103030620.000|TR0|NYPD officer to die from exposure to toxic 
20110103030620.000|20110103030623.000|TR0|chemicals at the ground zero site.  
20110103030623.000|20110103030625.000|TR0|Zadroga was not a smoker.  He did not have 
20110103030625.000|20110103030628.000|TR0|any known history of asthma and his family 
20110103030628.000|20110103030630.000|TR0|says he spent 450 hours working at ground 
20110103030630.000|20110103030633.000|TR0|zero after the attacks.
20110103030633.000|20110103030636.000|TR0|
20110103030636.000|20110103030638.000|TR0|In West Central Ohio, the man who killed a 
20110103030638.000|20110103030641.000|TR0|sheriff's deputy on New Year's Day has 
20110103030641.000|20110103030643.000|TR0|been identified now, 57-year-old Michael 
20110103030643.000|20110103030646.000|TR0|Ferryman.  He was found dead inside of a 
20110103030646.000|20110103030649.000|TR0|mobile home after an intense gun battle 
20110103030649.000|20110103030651.000|TR0|with police.  Officer Jeremy Blum was 
20110103030651.000|20110103030654.000|TR0|wounded in the standoff.  He's now in fair

20110103030730.000|20110103030733.000|TR0|gunfire in the trailer park.  Police say

20110103030735.000|20110103030738.000|TR0|shotgun blast before she had time to even

20110103030809.000|20110103030812.000|TR0|earthquake.  It struck about seven hours 
20110103030812.000|20110103030814.000|TR0|ago near the town of Temuco.  People could 
20110103030814.000|20110103030817.000|TR0|feel it all the way in the capital 
20110103030817.000|20110103030819.000|TR0|Santiago about 400 miles away, but except 
20110103030819.000|20110103030822.000|TR0|for cutting some power and phone lines, 
20110103030822.000|20110103030825.000|TR0|damage does appear to be minimal at this 
20110103030825.000|20110103030827.000|TR0|point, and no tsunami warning was issued.

20110103031011.000|20110103031014.000|TR0|blackbirds just fell from the sky in the 
20110103031014.000|20110103031016.000|TR0|town of Beebe. This happened just before

20110103031019.000|20110103031021.000|TR0|tonight, we're learning that some 100,000 
20110103031021.000|20110103031024.000|TR0|fish have washed up on the shores of the 
20110103031024.000|20110103031026.000|TR0|Arkansas River, which is about 125 miles

20110103031052.000|20110103031055.000|TR0|KEITH STEPHENS, SPOKESMAN, ARKANSAS GAME 
20110103031055.000|20110103031058.000|TR0|AND FISH COMMISSION (via telephone):  
20110103031058.000|20110103031100.000|TR0|Pretty strange things going on here in 
20110103031100.000|20110103031103.000|TR0|Arkansas.  Unusual events that we don't 
20110103031103.000|20110103031105.000|TR0|often see.  We do have fish die-offs from 
20110103031105.000|20110103031108.000|TR0|time to time.  Obviously, this is a pretty 
20110103031108.000|20110103031111.000|TR0|large one.  So, it's got our attention.  
20110103031111.000|20110103031113.000|TR0|The birds, that's really unusual.  We've 
20110103031113.000|20110103031116.000|TR0|had birds that have fallen out of sky 
20110103031116.000|20110103031118.000|TR0|before but not in this number.
20110103031118.000|20110103031121.000|TR0|
20110103031121.000|20110103031124.000|TR0|JACQUI JERAS, AMS METEOROLOGIST:  Yes, 
20110103031124.000|20110103031126.000|TR0|we've heard of birds falling out of the 
20110103031126.000|20110103031129.000|TR0|sky, you know, due to storms and 
20110103031129.000|20110103031131.000|TR0|thunderstorms and things like that.  What 
20110103031131.000|20110103031134.000|TR0|do you think happened?
20110103031134.000|20110103031137.000|TR0|
20110103031137.000|20110103031139.000|TR0|STEPHENS:  Well, we think that there's a 
20110103031139.000|20110103031142.000|TR0|possibility that maybe some New Year's Eve 
20110103031142.000|20110103031144.000|TR0|revelers in the area where the birds were 
20110103031144.000|20110103031147.000|TR0|roosting may have shot some fireworks off 
20110103031147.000|20110103031149.000|TR0|and stressed the birds to the point where 
20110103031149.000|20110103031152.000|TR0|they actually died.
20110103031152.000|20110103031155.000|TR0|
20110103031155.000|20110103031157.000|TR0|KEILAR:  We're talking now -- in the break 
20110103031157.000|20110103031200.000|TR0|you were -- you think it might have 
20110103031200.000|20110103031202.000|TR0|literally been that they had heart attacks 
20110103031202.000|20110103031205.000|TR0|because they were so -- sort of there was 
20110103031205.000|20110103031208.000|TR0|such a fright for them.
20110103031208.000|20110103031210.000|TR0|

20110103031213.000|20110103031215.000|TR0|send the birds off to two testing 
20110103031215.000|20110103031218.000|TR0|facilities where they will do necropsies

20110103031223.000|20110103031226.000|TR0|pointing to that right now.  It obviously 
20110103031226.000|20110103031228.000|TR0|could be a weather event, but we're kind 
20110103031228.000|20110103031231.000|TR0|of leaning the other way.
20110103031231.000|20110103031234.000|TR0|
20110103031234.000|20110103031236.000|TR0|JERAS:  Yes, and this is, I mean, 5,000 
20110103031236.000|20110103031239.000|TR0|birds.  That's a lot of birds and they 
20110103031239.000|20110103031241.000|TR0|were scattered across a pretty large area

20110103031244.000|20110103031247.000|TR0|details.  People woke up and the birds 
20110103031247.000|20110103031249.000|TR0|were in their yards.
20110103031249.000|20110103031252.000|TR0|
20110103031252.000|20110103031254.000|TR0|STEPHENS:  That's right.  It happened just 
20110103031254.000|20110103031257.000|TR0|before midnight.  One of our wildlife 
20110103031257.000|20110103031300.000|TR0|officers was actually on the scene.  By 
20110103031300.000|20110103031302.000|TR0|the time he got there, there were still 
20110103031302.000|20110103031305.000|TR0|birds that were falling.  It's a rural 
20110103031305.000|20110103031307.000|TR0|area of Arkansas and there's a lot of 
20110103031307.000|20110103031310.000|TR0|blackbirds that tend to migrate around the 
20110103031310.000|20110103031312.000|TR0|agricultural fields in the state, and they 
20110103031312.000|20110103031315.000|TR0|were roosting in an area where they 
20110103031315.000|20110103031318.000|TR0|typically roost.  And there were some 
20110103031318.000|20110103031320.000|TR0|people in the subdivision that were

20110103031323.000|20110103031325.000|TR0|New Year's and may have caused this.  We 
20110103031325.000|20110103031328.000|TR0|just don't know this at this point. 
20110103031328.000|20110103031331.000|TR0|KEILAR:  And, Keith, back to the fish, I 
20110103031331.000|20110103031333.000|TR0|mean, what are the different things.  You 
20110103031333.000|20110103031336.000|TR0|said that this is an entirely -- it 
20110103031336.000|20110103031338.000|TR0|happens from time to time although this is 
20110103031338.000|20110103031341.000|TR0|a big one.  What are the different reasons

20110103031344.000|20110103031346.000|TR0|
20110103031346.000|20110103031349.000|TR0|STEPHENS:  Most of the time when we do 
20110103031349.000|20110103031351.000|TR0|have fish kills, it's low oxygen levels. 
20110103031351.000|20110103031354.000|TR0|The fish can't breathe or the water is too 
20110103031354.000|20110103031357.000|TR0|warm for our trout, but they are usually 
20110103031357.000|20110103031359.000|TR0|really small.  Sometimes we do have 
20110103031359.000|20110103031402.000|TR0|diseases that will kill fish, but they are

20110103031410.000|20110103031412.000|TR0|fish.  So we feel like that we'll narrow

20110103031415.000|20110103031417.000|TR0|

20110103031604.000|20110103031606.000|TR0|
20110103031606.000|20110103031609.000|TR0|(COMMERCIAL BREAK)
20110103031609.000|20110103031611.000|TR0|
20110103031611.000|20110103031614.000|TR0|KEILAR:  With all of the holiday drinking 
20110103031614.000|20110103031617.000|TR0|right now, you've probably seen some 
20110103031617.000|20110103031619.000|TR0|police roadblocks out there, and if you 
20110103031619.000|20110103031622.000|TR0|get stopped or suspected DUI, good luck 
20110103031622.000|20110103031624.000|TR0|trying to refuse the breathalyzer.  Nine 
20110103031624.000|20110103031627.000|TR0|states now use "no refusal" checkpoints.
20110103031627.000|20110103031630.000|TR0|
20110103031630.000|20110103031632.000|TR0|What does that mean?  Well, police can 
20110103031632.000|20110103031635.000|TR0|immediately get a judge's order to draw 
20110103031635.000|20110103031637.000|TR0|blood if you say no to the breathalyzer.  
20110103031637.000|20110103031640.000|TR0|This is a pretty big deal because one in 
20110103031640.000|20110103031643.000|TR0|four, that's right, one in four DUI 
20110103031643.000|20110103031645.000|TR0|suspects refuse to blow into that plastic 
20110103031645.000|20110103031648.000|TR0|tube.
20110103031648.000|20110103031650.000|TR0|
20110103031650.000|20110103031653.000|TR0|New Hampshire significantly higher, 81% 
20110103031653.000|20110103031656.000|TR0|will not voluntarily take the test.  Now, 
20110103031656.000|20110103031658.000|TR0|you may not be surprised.  "No refusal" is 
20110103031658.000|20110103031701.000|TR0|pretty controversial.  Groups like Mothers 
20110103031701.000|20110103031703.000|TR0|against Drunk Driving say it's necessary 
20110103031703.000|20110103031706.000|TR0|to save lives but civil libertarians say 
20110103031706.000|20110103031709.000|TR0|that this is an overreach of police power.
20110103031709.000|20110103031711.000|TR0|
20110103031711.000|20110103031714.000|TR0|And joining me now, Warren Diepraam.  He 
20110103031714.000|20110103031716.000|TR0|is the assistant district attorney in 
20110103031716.000|20110103031719.000|TR0|Houston.  He's a strong proponent of the 
20110103031719.000|20110103031722.000|TR0|"no refusal" program.  And with me here in 
20110103031722.000|20110103031724.000|TR0|Atlanta is criminal defense attorney B.J. 
20110103031724.000|20110103031727.000|TR0|Bernstein.
20110103031727.000|20110103031729.000|TR0|
20110103031729.000|20110103031732.000|TR0|And first, we're going to start with 
20110103031732.000|20110103031734.000|TR0|Warren in Houston.  But, you know, 
20110103031734.000|20110103031737.000|TR0|explain, Warren, how this works.  How can 
20110103031737.000|20110103031740.000|TR0|a cop at a traffic stop immediately get a 
20110103031740.000|20110103031742.000|TR0|judge's order for a blood test?
20110103031742.000|20110103031745.000|TR0|
20110103031745.000|20110103031747.000|TR0|WARREN DIEPRAAM, ASST. DIST. ATTY., 
20110103031747.000|20110103031750.000|TR0|MONTGOMERY CO., TEXAS:  Well, it's through 
20110103031750.000|20110103031753.000|TR0|the use of the internet and technology.  
20110103031753.000|20110103031755.000|TR0|We're not doing it out on the streets.  
20110103031755.000|20110103031758.000|TR0|They are actually taken to a centralized 
20110103031758.000|20110103031800.000|TR0|facility, a police department or some sort 
20110103031800.000|20110103031803.000|TR0|of a fire station or someplace where all 
20110103031803.000|20110103031806.000|TR0|the tools are in place to get that search 
20110103031806.000|20110103031808.000|TR0|warrant reviewed and signed by a judge and 
20110103031808.000|20110103031811.000|TR0|to get that blood taken as soon as the 
20110103031811.000|20110103031813.000|TR0|search warrant is signed.
20110103031813.000|20110103031816.000|TR0|
20110103031816.000|20110103031819.000|TR0|KEILAR:  So you're saying it's not done 
20110103031819.000|20110103031821.000|TR0|right out there.  There's no judge 
20110103031821.000|20110103031824.000|TR0|necessarily right there or there is?
20110103031824.000|20110103031826.000|TR0|
20110103031826.000|20110103031829.000|TR0|DIEPRAAM:  No.  There is -- there is no 
20110103031829.000|20110103031832.000|TR0|judge on the street.  We do have Bat 
20110103031832.000|20110103031834.000|TR0|mobiles or portable breath alcohol testing 
20110103031834.000|20110103031837.000|TR0|mobile units that we use with the 
20110103031837.000|20110103031839.000|TR0|Montgomery County Sheriff's Office or the 
20110103031839.000|20110103031842.000|TR0|Houston Police Department.  Every now and 
20110103031842.000|20110103031845.000|TR0|then, we have nurses and judges available 
20110103031845.000|20110103031847.000|TR0|there.  That we take people to a 
20110103031847.000|20110103031850.000|TR0|centralized facility where it's 
20110103031850.000|20110103031852.000|TR0|sterilized.  The judges are separated from 
20110103031852.000|20110103031855.000|TR0|the defendants and from the suspects and 
20110103031855.000|20110103031858.000|TR0|the police.
20110103031858.000|20110103031900.000|TR0|
20110103031900.000|20110103031903.000|TR0|So it pretty -- it's a pretty extensive 
20110103031903.000|20110103031905.000|TR0|operation.  But all it takes is an arrest, 
20110103031905.000|20110103031908.000|TR0|quick five-minute transport to the closest 
20110103031908.000|20110103031910.000|TR0|police station and we can get a search 
20110103031910.000|20110103031913.000|TR0|warrant drafted and reviewed and signed, 
20110103031913.000|20110103031916.000|TR0|and under five minutes.
20110103031916.000|20110103031918.000|TR0|
20110103031918.000|20110103031921.000|TR0|KEILAR:  But I think the point, B.J., that 
20110103031921.000|20110103031923.000|TR0|you would make is this is an orchestrated 
20110103031923.000|20110103031926.000|TR0|situation where the judge is standing by, 
20110103031926.000|20110103031929.000|TR0|ready to make a ruling, and you have some 
20110103031929.000|20110103031931.000|TR0|major concerns about this and you feel 
20110103031931.000|20110103031934.000|TR0|like this is an overreach.
20110103031934.000|20110103031936.000|TR0|
20110103031936.000|20110103031939.000|TR0|B.J. BERNSTEIN, CRIMINAL DEFENSE ATTORNEY: 
20110103031939.000|20110103031942.000|TR0| Absolutely.  There is an overreach in 
20110103031942.000|20110103031944.000|TR0|terms of what Warren just said, where he 
20110103031944.000|20110103031947.000|TR0|said here's the person driving up to  a 
20110103031947.000|20110103031949.000|TR0|roadblock which normally we're all used to 
20110103031949.000|20110103031952.000|TR0|and we've accepted and we give a driver's 
20110103031952.000|20110103031955.000|TR0|license.  It's an opportunity for an 
20110103031955.000|20110103031957.000|TR0|officer to look at our eyes, listen to our 
20110103031957.000|20110103032000.000|TR0|speech, see signs of intoxication to see 
20110103032000.000|20110103032002.000|TR0|whether then a breathalyzer should be 
20110103032002.000|20110103032005.000|TR0|administered.
20110103032005.000|20110103032008.000|TR0|
20110103032008.000|20110103032010.000|TR0|Rather here he just said it.  He arrests 
20110103032010.000|20110103032013.000|TR0|someone and takes them to a judge for 
20110103032013.000|20110103032015.000|TR0|simply saying no when laws historically 
20110103032015.000|20110103032018.000|TR0|have been that the right to drive -- we 
20110103032018.000|20110103032021.000|TR0|don't have a right to drive in this 
20110103032021.000|20110103032023.000|TR0|country, but when you refuse, it does an 
20110103032023.000|20110103032026.000|TR0|effect on your license.  You lose your 
20110103032026.000|20110103032028.000|TR0|license in some states, either one to two 
20110103032028.000|20110103032031.000|TR0|years for refusing.  But that's very 
20110103032031.000|20110103032033.000|TR0|different than saying, you know, I'm OK 
20110103032033.000|20110103032036.000|TR0|with my blood being taken.
20110103032036.000|20110103032039.000|TR0|
20110103032039.000|20110103032041.000|TR0|KEILAR:  But some might say, you know, if 
20110103032041.000|20110103032044.000|TR0|you're refusing, even if there is a 
20110103032044.000|20110103032046.000|TR0|consequence for refusing, a person might 
20110103032046.000|20110103032049.000|TR0|be refusing to do the breathalyzer because 
20110103032049.000|20110103032052.000|TR0|they're hoping to give themselves a little 
20110103032052.000|20110103032054.000|TR0|time for their blood alcohol level to go 
20110103032054.000|20110103032057.000|TR0|down.  I mean, isn't refusing in a way 
20110103032057.000|20110103032059.000|TR0|something that should be punished?  Isn't 
20110103032059.000|20110103032102.000|TR0|it in a way an admission of oh, no, I know 
20110103032102.000|20110103032105.000|TR0|that I may be going over the limit here?
20110103032105.000|20110103032107.000|TR0|
20110103032107.000|20110103032110.000|TR0|BERNSTEIN:  Well, it is punishing in terms 
20110103032110.000|20110103032112.000|TR0|of taking your driver's license through 
20110103032112.000|20110103032115.000|TR0|civil things.  But regardless -- I mean, 
20110103032115.000|20110103032118.000|TR0|we're talking about a criminal case.  The 
20110103032118.000|20110103032120.000|TR0|constitutional rules apply and, yes, 
20110103032120.000|20110103032123.000|TR0|there's been U.S. Supreme Court precedent 
20110103032123.000|20110103032125.000|TR0|to allow a blood test to be taken, but 
20110103032125.000|20110103032128.000|TR0|that's based on probable cause.  And I 
20110103032128.000|20110103032131.000|TR0|would argue that it's a slippery slope for 
20110103032131.000|20110103032133.000|TR0|a misdemeanor offense that probable cause 
20110103032133.000|20110103032136.000|TR0|is just because you don't choose to take a 
20110103032136.000|20110103032138.000|TR0|government test that is not required by 
20110103032138.000|20110103032141.000|TR0|law.
20110103032141.000|20110103032144.000|TR0|
20110103032144.000|20110103032146.000|TR0|KEILAR:  And Warren, how is this better, 
20110103032146.000|20110103032149.000|TR0|do you think, how is this better than the 
20110103032149.000|20110103032151.000|TR0|current -- I mean, obviously, this is 
20110103032151.000|20110103032154.000|TR0|going on in jurisdictions in several 
20110103032154.000|20110103032156.000|TR0|states, but how is this better than those 
20110103032156.000|20110103032159.000|TR0|jurisdictions that are not using the no 
20110103032159.000|20110103032202.000|TR0|refusal plan?
20110103032202.000|20110103032204.000|TR0|
20110103032204.000|20110103032207.000|TR0|DIEPRAAM:  Well, there are people watching 
20110103032207.000|20110103032209.000|TR0|the program tonight that are alive because 
20110103032209.000|20110103032212.000|TR0|of this program.  In my jurisdiction of 
20110103032212.000|20110103032215.000|TR0|about 500,000 people, our DWI fatality 
20110103032215.000|20110103032217.000|TR0|rates have dropped off close to 20 
20110103032217.000|20110103032220.000|TR0|percent.  We've gone almost two years 
20110103032220.000|20110103032222.000|TR0|during the program's operational hours 
20110103032222.000|20110103032225.000|TR0|without an alcohol-related fatality where 
20110103032225.000|20110103032228.000|TR0|an innocent victim was killed.
20110103032228.000|20110103032230.000|TR0|
20110103032230.000|20110103032233.000|TR0|You cannot argue with the fact that it 
20110103032233.000|20110103032235.000|TR0|saves lives, and I'm glad to hear that 
20110103032235.000|20110103032238.000|TR0|some defense attorneys acknowledge that it 
20110103032238.000|20110103032241.000|TR0|is constitutional.  We don't even have to 
20110103032241.000|20110103032243.000|TR0|get search warrants to get blood in DWI 
20110103032243.000|20110103032246.000|TR0|cases but we do.  We give extra due 
20110103032246.000|20110103032248.000|TR0|process to our suspects.  It is not like 
20110103032248.000|20110103032251.000|TR0|we're pulling people off the street.  They 
20110103032251.000|20110103032254.000|TR0|do field sobriety tests.  They fail field 
20110103032254.000|20110103032256.000|TR0|sobriety tests.  They're given an 
20110103032256.000|20110103032259.000|TR0|opportunity to comply with the law and 
20110103032259.000|20110103032301.000|TR0|give a breath test. It's only after that 
20110103032301.000|20110103032304.000|TR0|we get involved and present a search 
20110103032304.000|20110103032307.000|TR0|warrant to a neutral and attached 
20110103032307.000|20110103032309.000|TR0|magistrate.
20110103032309.000|20110103032312.000|TR0|
20110103032312.000|20110103032314.000|TR0|In addition to saving lives, we've reduced 
20110103032314.000|20110103032317.000|TR0|our number of DWIs significantly, close to 
20110103032317.000|20110103032320.000|TR0|30 percent.  Our crashes, everything.  Our 
20110103032320.000|20110103032322.000|TR0|conviction rate is close to 100 percent 
20110103032322.000|20110103032325.000|TR0|with this.
20110103032325.000|20110103032327.000|TR0|
20110103032327.000|20110103032330.000|TR0|And lastly, the benefit of the program is 
20110103032330.000|20110103032332.000|TR0|we also save a sample for defense 
20110103032332.000|20110103032335.000|TR0|attorneys.  So if they want to get 
20110103032335.000|20110103032338.000|TR0|independent testing with the blood, we do 
20110103032338.000|20110103032340.000|TR0|that as well.  So there's no downside to 
20110103032340.000|20110103032343.000|TR0|this program.  It saves lives.  It reduces 
20110103032343.000|20110103032345.000|TR0|costs.  It puts more police officers on 
20110103032345.000|20110103032348.000|TR0|the street, and it can be done almost 
20110103032348.000|20110103032351.000|TR0|instantaneously in most states without 
20110103032351.000|20110103032353.000|TR0|legislative involvement or approval.
20110103032353.000|20110103032356.000|TR0|
20110103032356.000|20110103032358.000|TR0|KEILAR:  And let me ask you this, B.J., as 
20110103032358.000|20110103032401.000|TR0|a criminal defense attorney.  This is not 
20110103032401.000|20110103032404.000|TR0|going to be -- just quickly, this is not

20110103035815.000|20110103035818.000|TR0|off, the woman, who was the model for the 
20110103035818.000|20110103035821.000|TR0|famous wartime Rosie the Riveter poster, 
20110103035821.000|20110103035823.000|TR0|has died.  Eighty-year-old Geraldine Doyle 
20110103035823.000|20110103035826.000|TR0|passed away at a hospice in Michigan.  
20110103035826.000|20110103035828.000|TR0|Doyle was working in a plant near Ann 
20110103035828.000|20110103035831.000|TR0|Arbor in 1942 when a photographer snapped 
20110103035831.000|20110103035834.000|TR0|her picture, well documenting how women 
20110103035834.000|20110103035836.000|TR0|were contributing to the war effort.  The 
20110103035836.000|20110103035839.000|TR0|poster grew even more popular in the 1980s

20110103035849.000|20110103035852.000|TR0|And a nation known for its food is

20110103035854.000|20110103035857.000|TR0|the market.  This is all in the name of 
20110103035857.000|20110103035900.000|TR0|protecting the environment.  As of 
20110103035900.000|20110103035902.000|TR0|yesterday, shopkeepers in Italy are banned 
20110103035902.000|20110103035905.000|TR0|from using plastic bags.  They can keep 
20110103035905.000|20110103035907.000|TR0|using them, of course, until their 
20110103035907.000|20110103035910.000|TR0|existing supply runs out and then that is 
20110103035910.000|20110103035913.000|TR0|going to be it.  Italy is not alone,

20110103035915.000|20110103035918.000|TR0|cities around the world, many here in the 
20110103035918.000|20110103035920.000|TR0|U.S., have already instituted such bans.
